ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Hannibal Weapon Systems. Standard, default armor configuration for all recruited Spartan personnel.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Recruit Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Materials Group. Mjolnir's mainline armor kit, designed by the Materials Group out of Damascus.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Warrior Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Materials Group. One of the longest running configurations currently on the Mjolnir platform.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Scout Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Materials Group. Rigorously tested at historic DTF on the remote and rocky world of Chi Ceti IV.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Soldier Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Imbrium Machine Complex. Ankara's renowned IMC took ownership of RECON production after the war.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Recon Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Acheron Security. Manufactured and battle-tested just outside of the city of Gdynia on Mars.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Hazop Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Naphtali Contractor Corporation. Abilene's NCC took over production of this Mjolnir kit in 2554.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: E.O.D. Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Acheron Security. Used by security escort during the first exploration efforts on Installation 03.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Pioneer Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Hannibal Weapon Systems. Tested in the orbital battleclusters high above the beautiful planet of New Carthage.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Infiltrator Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Naphtali Contractor Corporation. Used along Luna's skyhooks and tethers during the Covenant's assault on Sol.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Orbital Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Naphtali Contractor Corporation. Primarily used by ONI security personnel on the skyhooks above Earth and Luna.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Air Assault Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Hannibal Weapon Systems. Manufactured by New Carthage's reputable HWS in the industrial township of Kotka.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Vanguard Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Imbrium Machine Complex. Developed in Ankara, this is the primary armor set for remote base security detail.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Enforcer Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Hannibal Weapon Systems. Now widely used, this armor was originally designed in parallel with the nonlinear rifle.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Gungnir Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Hannibal Weapon Systems. Recommended armor systems for Broadsword A/X engagement pilots.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Aviator Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Imbrium Machine Complex. IMC field tested this armor in the hostile outlands of 'Bosque de Negro'.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Pathfinder Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Acheron Security. Designed for counter-intelligence operability in the Martian territory of Acheron Fossae.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: C.I.O. Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: 343 Industries. Battle-tested on the rough and tumble streets of downtown Kirkland, Washington, FOTUS-class armor has historically received high movement proficiency ratings for coffee runs on rainy days. Warning: COUGAR-class safety protocols MUST be followed at all times.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: FOTUS Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Hannibal Weapon Systems. Used extensively during the recovery of Terceira from the United Rebel Front.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Oceanic Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Imbrium Machine Complex. Currently employed at research facilities on Trevelyan and Gamma Halo.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Defender Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Naphtali Contractor Corporation. Tested in the NCC's abandoned shipyards on the outskirts of Abilene.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Operator Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Lethbridge Industrial. Gained prominence during the defense of Concord from the Covenant in 2551.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Venator Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Naphtali Contractor Corporation. Now produced by the NCC, this armor is loosely based on the GEN1 variant.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Commando Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Lethbridge Industrial. Experienced widespread use during the classified raids against rebels on Talitsa.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Wetwork Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Lethbridge Industrial. Lethbridge Industrial's most popular armor set is ironically its most exotic.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: War Master Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Imbrium Machine Complex. Per IMC, this armor's feral design is intended to weaken the opposition's morale.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Raider Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Lethbridge Industrial. Designed for remote operatives engaging in hostile environmental conditions.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Ranger Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Materials Group. Classic variant of Mjolnir GEN1 designed for extra-vehicular activity operations.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: E.V.A. Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Lethbridge Industrial. First introduced into combat theaters toward the end of the Thales expeditions.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Engineer Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Naphtali Contractor Corporation. Developed by the NCC via intel previously gleaned from Jiralhanae stealth kits.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Stalker Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Hannibal Weapon Systems. HWS acquired this armor from Vestol Corp after the Covenant's assault of Tribute.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Rogue Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Acheron Security. Favored by operatives conducting off-world tracking of high risk targets.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Tracker Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Materials Group. Last series of mainline Mjolnir GEN1 armor types worn by SPARTAN-II personnel.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Mark VI Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Materials Group. Dominant variant in the Materials Group's newest prototype security line.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Protector Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Hannibal Weapon Systems. Originally tested in the ship graveyards hanging above the Tribute's north pole.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Deadeye Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Lethbridge Industrial. Despite its exotic design, most operators select this armor based on its resiliency.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Locus Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Materials Group. Produced by the Materials Group primarily for search-and-rescue outfits.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Scanner Helmet

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Imbrium Machine Complex. Primary armor set for jaunt-combat excursion in isolated theatres.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Strider Helmet

Battle-tested on the rough and tumble streets of downtown Kirkland, Washington, FOTUS-class armor has historically received high movement proficiency ratings for coffee runs on rainy days. Warning: COUGAR-class safety protocols MUST be followed at all times.

ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Recruit Forearms

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Materials Group. Inner-plated systems gained popularity during the revolt on Terceira.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Inner-plated Forearms

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Naphtali Contractor Corporation. Twin-plate systems first saw use in 2556, but was prototyped during Mjolnir's GEN1 era.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Twin-plated Forearms

ArmorItemMetadata.Name: FOTUS Forearms

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Naphtali Contractor Corporation. Shifting systems were tested by NCC in the notable Buffalo Breaker Yards.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: XV-27 Shifting Forearms

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Acheron Security. Manufactured on the planet Mars, locking systems improve comfort through modularity.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: GV-09 Locking Forearms

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Lethbridge Industrial. Outer-plated systems were originally conceived for engagement operators on Cascade.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Outer-plated Forearms

ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Contoured Forearms

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Materials Group. Classic GEN1 system for Mjolnir Mark VI, most notably worn by S-II personnel in 2552.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Mark VI Forearms

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Materials Group. Standardized RECRUIT-class systems, vetted in DTF's 'FFG-045' combat lab.. Customized with PRIME armor skin.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Recruit PRME Forearms

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Naphtali Contractor Corporation. Shifting systems were tested by NCC in the notable Buffalo Breaker Yards.. Customized with PULSE armor skin.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: XV-27 Shifting PULS Forearms

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Lethbridge Industrial. Contoured units were favored during the hostilities of the Thales Expedition.. Customized with CHEVRON armor skin.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Contoured CHVR Forearms

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Naphtali Contractor Corporation. Twin-plate systems first saw use in 2556, but was prototyped during Mjolnir's GEN1 era.. Customized with AEON armor skin.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Twin-plated AEON Forearms

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Acheron Security. Manufactured on the planet Mars, locking systems improve comfort through modularity.. Customized with FOREST armor skin.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: GV-09 Locking FRST Forearms

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Materials Group. Inner-plated systems gained popularity during the revolt on Terceira.. Customized with WEB armor skin.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Inner-plated WEB Forearms

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Lethbridge Industrial. Outer-plated systems were originally conceived for engagement operators on Cascade.. Customized with RAPTOR armor skin.
ArmorItemMetadata.Name: Outer-plated RPTR Forearms

ArmorItemMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Naphtali Contractor Corporation. Shifting systems were tested by NCC in the notable Buffalo Breaker Yards.. Customized with CIRCUIT armor skin.
